meanings.definition: Any of a class of natural substances derived from polyunsaturated fatty acids, including the prostaglandins, thromboxanes, and leukotrienes, which are involved in inflammation and immunity.
meanings.sent1: The eicosanoid played a crucial role in causing inflammation in the body.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are studying the effects of eicosanoids on the immune system.
meanings.sent3: The eicosanoid decided to throw a party in the body, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: Like tiny messengers, eicosanoids deliver important signals to cells.
meanings.sent5: The eicosanoid was like a superhero, fighting inflammation wherever it went.

meanings.definition: A hormone-like compound that regulates cell activity and inflammation in the body.
meanings.sent1: The eicosanoid helps control inflammation in the body.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are investigating the role of eicosanoids in cell regulation.
meanings.sent3: The eicosanoid tried to calm down the rowdy cells at the party.
meanings.sent4: In the body's orchestra, eicosanoids are the conductors of cell activity.
meanings.sent5: Imagine eicosanoids as tiny traffic controllers directing cell traffic.
